titleStmt.title: An entry from the Journals of Hensley Henson

sourceDesc.bibl: Edited from the manuscripts in the custody of Durham Cathedral Library.

p.hi: Still the article, & still a poor result of effort! Of all kinds of composition, those which include the copying out of quotations bore me most. Mason, the Vicar of Diddlesbury, lunched here, & promised to be "meek as Moses" in his dealing with the owner of Westhope! The new Dean & his wife came to tea. They look pleasant, & are said to be ever popular.
